abstract.t: This document describes the interfaces and functionality of portable socket objects, each instantiated and delegated per Unicast/Multicast Endpoint Identifiers(EID), using eBPF like Unix stacks. Sockets are deployed across edge-compute locations and are used either as queues for assembling upstream point to point and multipoint to point frames, or as a channels, segmenting point to multipoint and multipoint to multipoint application frames. Portability of Unicast-queue and Multicast-channel sockets, as well as subscription and replication, is achieved using the Locator/ID Separation Protocol (LISP).
